subject: Re: [junit] Re: About mock object :!
msgSnippet: From:  ... sorry, I kinda assumed that. Should have made it clearer. Steve
messageBody:
From: <tammo.freese@...>
> --- In junit@y..., "Steve Freeman" <steve@m...> wrote:
> > subclass it and override just those methods you need to use. The
> implementations of the overridings should be absolutely simple (just
> return fixed or preloaded values). If the object is not well designed
> this can be tricky, but sometimes you can get through with a little
> careful refactoring.
> >
>
> Wouldn't it be better to overload all methods, and let the unused
> ones always throw RuntimeExceptions? This would prevent hard-to-spot
> errors that accidently use real behaviour instead of mock behaviour.

sorry, I kinda assumed that. Should have made it clearer.

Steve
